idea-plugin.name: Open in Git host
idea-plugin.description:
Determines the remote URL of a git commit or file and runs it through enabled extensions. Extensions allow the URL to be opened in the default browser and copied to the clipboard etc.

After installing select your remote host and the extensions you want enabled in Settings → Other Settings → Open in Git host (currently supports the hosts GitHub, Stash, BitBucket and GitLab). Make sure you have registered your project's root under the version control settings. Preferences â†’ Version Control (see unregistered roots)

To use, open a file that is under Git version control in the editor and select View → Open in Git host. You can also access this action through the Select target menu under Navigate → Select in. If you want to view a specific commit, you can do this by right clicking the commit from the VCS log tool window and selecting Open in Git host.

Note: The current branch is used unless it does not exist in your remote host in which case it defaults to the master branch.
